title: forge fails with `GLIBC_2.33' not found (required by forge) in github action CI
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

nightly-2e99f7fdaef6a7aaeb426b02ef87e052cc14f68b

### What command(s) is the bug in?

_No response_

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

We use the [foundry-toolchain](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain) github action in our CI and it started failing in the last few hours with failures like this:

```
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.33' not found (required by forge)
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.32' not found (required by forge)
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.34' not found (required by forge)
```

Is there a problem with the nightly release?

I didn't include the proper `forge --version` string, because `forge` can't even run that in our CI. It started failing after the latest release:
  - latest release broken: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/releases/tag/nightly-2e99f7fdaef6a7aaeb426b02ef87e052cc14f68b
  - previous one is fine: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/tree/nightly-f6361e6ddb6af62bbf6e122d0d8b27d2f5f6b42d

this looks like a docker issue that somehow compile and execution libc differs

checking

could you perhaps dump relevant parts of the CI job? 
wasn't able to reproduce this via github action

but I'm retriggering a release now
I`m having the same issue, happens on my local machine after the update as well, running on Ubuntu 20.04.5 LTS(libc official versions is 2.31-0ubuntu9.9)

can you please add your `forge --version`?
I triggered a new release, it seems to be related to how the release is build

> can you please add your `forge --version`? I triggered a new release, it seems to be related to how the release is build

nightly-2e99f7fdaef6a7aaeb426b02ef87e052cc14f68b

I triggered a new release 1h ago, but this is still present?

could you please add the relevant CI output?

> I triggered a new release 1h ago, but this is still present?
> 
> could you please add the relevant CI output?

still present. The CI test in my repo just failed 2 minutes ago with the same error

is this public?

any chance you can add or link the relevant CI output?

> is this public?
> 
> any chance you can add or link the relevant CI output?

yes, (REPO LINK IS DELETED)

As you can see, it failed on "Run Forge Test" step.  Here is the output:
> Run forge test --ffi
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.33' not found (required by forge)
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.32' not found (required by forge)
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.34' not found (required by forge)
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.

> is this public?
> 
> any chance you can add or link the relevant CI output?

https://github.com/fiatdao/delphi-ii/actions

hmm, what's interesting is that the release workflow is run on a different runner `22.04.1` than the CI `20.04.5`, but both use `ubuntu-latest`, both have different software versions installed:

https://github.com/actions/runner-images/blob/ubuntu22/20221127.1/images/linux/Ubuntu2204-Readme.md

https://github.com/actions/runner-images/blob/ubuntu20/20221125.1/images/linux/Ubuntu2004-Readme.md

github just started to migrate ubuntu-latest to 22.04, which happens gradually https://github.com/actions/runner-images/issues/6399

could you perhaps try to change to

`runs-on: ubuntu-22.04` and retrigger a CI job?
I think this is mostly forwards compatible, so I wonder if we should pin the release runner to `20.04` for the time being.

> previous one is fine: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/tree/nightly-f6361e6ddb6af62bbf6e122d0d8b27d2f5f6b42d

This one was run with 20.04 as well:

https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/actions/runs/3597605800/jobs/6059525485

only the latest switched to 22.04, so this seems to be the cause.
Yeah. After switching to ubuntu-22.04, the CI test is passed.

> Yeah. After switching to ubuntu-22.04, the CI test is passed.

Same for our repo.
I am running into the same issue while using codespaces. I tried the above suggested solution to change to `runs-on: ubuntu-22.04` which doesn't work. Any suggestions how to solve this?

Also got:
```
forge test -w                                                                                    10:33:33
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.33' not found (required by forge)
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.32' not found (required by forge)
forge: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.34' not found (required by forge)
```

running on debian:

foundryup: installing foundry (version nightly, tag nightly-5206d4e9c8bbabe7b004a6ddc44e35b2f1bc72ee)

Facing similar issue when running ``foundryup` 

A dump of all erorrs = [`https://pastebin.com/raw/iW7V5Em6`](https://pastebin.com/raw/iW7V5Em6)

Solutions which worked --

```ml
git clone https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry
cd foundry
# install cast + forge
cargo install --path ./cli --profile local --bins --locked --force
# install anvil
cargo install --path ./anvil --profile local --locked --force
```

facing the same error:
- the CI actions file: https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/blob/main/.github/workflows/test-contracts.yml#L59
- Example CI failure: https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/actions/runs/3614265257/jobs/6090582873#step:10:1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25297591/205505511-b7448cd1-b533-4c38-a746-d9eb83f39f09.png)
+1 I also tried to pin the version and that didn't fix it:
> +1 I also tried to pin the version and that didn't fix it: > > Actually this seems like a separate issue -- I can't install this specific version on any machines. Is that expected?
We're on it - thx for the patience and debug info all.

> We're on it - thx for the patience and debug info all.

**Note by GitHub:** This comment was written directly on a roller-coaster.

https://twitter.com/transmissions11/status/1599203404383162369

PSA: please add "runs-on: ubuntu-22.04" in your CI. 

It looks like it's fixed it for a few people and the person that said it didn't work above seems to be having a different issue (unclear if related or not).

Here's how @mattsse did it https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/commit/36276aac0408fde8b00c19e2cfc3b7bec3fc429d

> PSA: please add "runs-on: ubuntu-22.04" in your CI.
> 
> It looks like it's fixed it for a few people and the person that said it didn't work above seems to be having a different issue (unclear if related or not).
> 
> Here's how @mattsse did it [36276aa](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/commit/36276aac0408fde8b00c19e2cfc3b7bec3fc429d)

This is much more challenging for folks running self-hosted infra and may break other dependencies. Can we also pin the build version to 20.04?

Foundry installation is failing in [slither-action](https://github.com/crytic/slither-action). This is a Docker container action where it's not possible to choose the OS it runs on, so the workaround above doesn't apply. It seems to be based on [Debian Bullseye](https://github.com/crytic/slither-action/blob/230a81be4564bd7c5c4b51b199af246e9db92e5b/Dockerfile#L1) (like Ubuntu 20).

> This has also been flagged to Github and they'll take a look tomorrow on business days. Sorry about that folks, out of control unfort.
> 
> > Can we also pin the build version to 20.04?
> 
> @kristian1108 Where, other than the release file?
> 
Thanks, @gakonst -- I think the release file should be sufficient. Just whatever machine these binaries are built on should be pinned to ubuntu 20.04. Appreciate y'alls quick efforts here.

>any ideas on workaround or fix?

I would've suggested updating slither-action to use a more recent Python image as the base, but I see they are all based on Bullseye so I'm guessing the error will persist.
